description:
One of my favorite places to kick it and celebrate over a beer or margarita and some   food. Great with just the wifey and with all the family (I've done a table for 12). 

Salsa music, TV's for games, nice service, and mariachi on the weekends. 

This place will always have a special little piece of my heart. 

Thank you for keepin it !
author: Noah M.

description: Favorite happy hour spot. Frozen mango margaritas with chili salt for $5 and delicious quesadilla. I've also been once at midnight and the whole bar burst into song. It's a local hangout spot and a lot of camaraderie.
author: Shaw L.

description: Had shot of Herradura! Can't go wrong! My friend had a margarita. She enjoyed it very much!
author: Teofila R.

description: The food, drinks and festive vibe here is great! Good place to grab dinner with a loved one, meet up for happy hour or to have a group gathering.
author: Andrew-Jefferson P.

description: Had a great time! The waitress was amazing! So sweet and accommodating to our group of 10! They have pitchers of margaritas and great food to munch on! Will definitely be back!
author: Leslie H.

description: Not only is the service top notch, but the food was absolutely amazing! I was having a few drinks and decided to order from the menu which included almost everything you expect from a taqueria. I ordered a super burrito (grilled chicken) and it was the best burrito I've had in the Mission area in a while. The meat was cooked perfectly and every bite tasted like the last bite of a burrito lol. For sure coming back more often for the food alone!
author: Carlos G.

description: I came into Cava's after work Sunday and had a Mango Margarita. Very good. The place was mellow, perfect. The place was redone which was nice. The owner was there came over and asked why it's taken so long for me to return and congratulated him on the upkeep of the place. The weekday happy hour is still the best in the Mission $4 Margaritas! Cava's opens at 4p perfect for after work. Like I always state when doing an update review what a difference a day makes.
author: Googie G.

description:
They have $4 Margaritas on Monday all night! And they're legitttttttt!  We tried the mango one and that blew my mind! Blended perfection with a little hit of taijin.

This bar is the best of both worlds.  Cheap drinks, TV's for the games, and a connected tacqueria that you can order from or just order from your seat.

Best bar to watch a Monday night game.
author: Hansen L.

description: A solid dive bar that appears to be quite popular with local Latino residents. Prices are quite decent given the fact that the drinks are gigantic and strong (OMG, those soup bowl-sized margaritas!) and the food is well-portioned. Service is also fast and super friendly, and overall it's a great place to watch a game, particularly the beloved hometown Giants. It's great to see independent venues like this still catering to true locals in the Mission.
author: Vincent L.

description: What a disappointment. Came in for a super taco. Ask for rice and beans on the bottom. Meat too tough to eat. Layered as meat, cheese, salsa, rice and beans on top. Threw it away because of the meat.
author: B C.

description: Was looking forward to having a few drinks with a friend, bar tender did not acknowledge us, and after being stared up and down by someone that didn't really seem to be employed there, she approached us and said they were closed when they clearly weren't. I'm truly disappointed in the way we were treated.
author: Brenda R.

description: Great margaritas! New menu. The tostaditas seem little good taste averall. We ordered the jalspeño quesadilla that was way to spicy to eat it. But the drinks were so delish i recommend this place to anyone who craves a good strong drink.
author: Alex G.

description: I'm usually pretty easy to please, but the super taco with a side of rice and beans were pretty darn disappointing- the refried beans were an odd color and tasted like they were straight out of a can. The cheese on the taco was horrible- a square slice of cheese that looked like it was a kraft singles or something that was "processed cheese food". Not at all fresh or authentic and honestly the whole meal just seemed lazy.
author: Lizzie C.

description: Great place to watch futbol! The drinks are strong food is improving! Appears they picked up a new chef who has been sampling off menu items, all of them delicious. Hopefully they'll add them to the regular rotation.
author: Max D.

description: Not what it used to be! The menu completely changed, they now charge for chips and salsa, and it isn't authentic Mexican anymore. So disappointed! This place used to be so good (restaurant side, not taqueria) wonder if it changed owners? Or maybe if they've Americanized the menu due to how gentrified thang area has gotten? Either way, never going back
author: Gizzy S.

description:
Jamie W. and I didn't know we had a hankering for margaritas until we accidentally found this watering hole on the way to Aster. We were actually waiting for our dinner reservation since we had more than an hour. Now we were considering the Latin American Club, but I wasn't feeling particularly edgy, disingenuous or young enough to fit in with the crowd there. We took a pass and decided to sit among the proletarians at the high-top table at Cava 22. There was only one table occupied and a few people at the bar watching the soccer game on the overhead screens. Yes, this was the vibe we wanted.

The margaritas are $7 at Happy Hour, and they're big goblets of party-time guzzling. We both got Strawberry Margaritas (photo: http://bit.ly/1Q4BgRT) because we lacked imagination to try anything else despite the allure of Watermelon, Peach and Lime options. We went for blended because that's my memory of what I used to get at Chevy's during my twenties. Tasty and pretty darn refreshing. We were getting a buzz, which may explain why we ordered the $5.50 Guacamole with Chips (photo: http://bit.ly/1Ms1urG) before a four-course dinner at Aster. Oh what the hell, it was my birthday after all and I needed avocado with my margarita. No need for me to explain.

A month later, after enjoying the three-hour San Francisco Movie Tour, we were feeling a bit parched, so off we went to Cava 22 just as they opened at 5PM. Rather than viewing such a move as a sure sign of alcoholism, we decided to partake with their margaritas again. Still refreshing, their refreshing sweetness required us to order the $7.50 Regular Nachos with Chicken (photo: http://bit.ly/1RnAY72). They weren't the best nachos ever, but who cares? They were there to munch on while we gulped our two margaritas in a row. Now I'm thinking Sharetea should offer a tequila chaser to their Coffee Ice Blended boba drink.

FOOD - 3 stars...here for the margaritas, the food is decent enough but incidental
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...pretty spacious for the Mission
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...server was quite nice and accommodating
TOTAL - 3 stars...I'm not wasting away in Margaritaville, honest
author: Ed U.

description: I love this place! I love that it's also one of the original restaurants from the mission. As a SF native and having grown up in the neighborhood, I appreciate businesses that are still around. Now on to the actual review of the restaurant, they've updated the place quiet a bit. It's a good place to watch a sporting event or to have a nice sit down dinner. Not that many places in SF have that. Their food is delicious and authentically Mexican (sorry abuelita but their food is almost as good as yours ) Their nachos and enchiladas are bomb-dot-com! And the ceviche OMG!!!! Their drinks, oh their drinks! The coconut margarita is my fav!! I love anything coconut so I was so excited to try it and yaaaaassssss!! The blue cava is also yummy! Their service is also good with their servers very attentive and nice. Overall, this restaurant is definitely one of my favs and I always recommend it to anyone visiting San Francisco, especially if they're looking for a place that locals go to :)
author: Sam G.

description: Mission staple. Want good drinks and a good time? It's the place to go. Great for groups and has a delicious rotating menu. My personal favs are the mushroom quesadilla, the chicken wings (yes delish for a Mexican spot) and the micheladas. It's a great spot cause there's always something for everyone.
author: Terry R.

description:
My daughter Gina, me and my granddaughter Athena had dinner at this place tonight.  The waiters were very nice and went well out of their way to give us excellent service.  They even made a virgin pina colada for my granddaughter (free of charge).

We had Salmon served with mash potatoes, lemony vinegarette dressing salad, steamed carrots, broccoli and cauliflower.

My daughter had the skirt steak, fingerling potatoes with the same salad as mine.  Fresh toasted french bread was brought to us too!

We ordered guacamole with chips and it was accompanied with some spicy salsa which I drizzled on my salmon.  I will most certainly return here again.
author: Karen B.

description: Favorite spot to come on Wednesdays. Wings on point , drinks on point and their server Claudia is amazing. Definitely recommend it.
author: Chop L.

description: Fun fun karaoke nights and excellent for a little food and drinks before going dancing in the Mission.
author: Patricia R.

description: Cool, quiet and relaxed atmosphere, although crowded and loud during the weekends. Went 2 times in 2 days, and each time was fun. The wait staff was attentive and insightful and the food was just fine, same you would get at a sports bar. First time I had a Quesadilla, which was made with cheap American cheese. It was just plain and boring. Second time was way better, got the Shrimp Ceviche Cocktail with Octopus, and although wasn't the best ceviche was way better than the quesadilla from the day before. The cocktail sauce tasted like ketchup though but it was still fine. Cava is not a bad option, especially if you come here on Monday nights; there are $4 margaritas available all night. And the there isn't any atmosphere of pretentiousness in any way, which makes it a bit different from most of bars in S.F.
author: Sofia B.

description:
Super Burrito, Carnitas with everything.

Too much fat, lack of flavor, ingredients not spread out which means mouthful of nothing but rice.  Too many places to go to for similar food that is 3x better within a block radius.  Won't be coming back for the food.
author: Kailo R.

description:
Dropped by last Thursday, February 11th around 11:30pm for a drink. We had just attended an event nearby and wanted one last drink before we all headed home.

We walked straight to the bar and decided to get Shots and beers. Yes, we ended our night with a shot of tequila and a beer. I guess it was one of their specials? All I know is we had their well tequila and the beer was pretty light.

The bar atmosphere was pretty chill. It wasn't super busy, so plenty of room at the bar. We easily grabbed a spot. They also have a long table right in front of the bar with stools. We were kind of taking up space at the bar and at the table in front before we realized we were blocking their walkway. I'd recommend picking one spot or the other as we ended up being that annoying group. Sorry!

Fun place to grab a quick drink. Our bartender was also really nice. We had a good time.
author: Elena N.

description: Great Mission District atmosphere. Ample selection of a variety of Margaritas and appetizers and Mexican food of your choice. Unpretentious or uppity a true neighborhood gem
author: Steven B.

description: Have a nice seat by he window and enjoy some of the most authentic, flavorful Mexican good on he heart of the Mission. There's a vibe that made feel at home as I was local city in Mexico. Service was on point and so were the Micheladas! Would definitely recommend this restaurant for anyone looking for a reasonably priced, authentic Mexican restaurant with great music!
author: Jony V.

description:
The food here is really good. I loved their sea food soup.  Can't get enough of it, and for it's price is just right. 

Speaking about prices... they fluctuate.  I would say to go during happy hour and you'll get a good deal. Outside happy hour, the drinks are not so cheap but still good.  That is why I'm not giving this place 5 stars. 

Enjoy the food, the ample ambience, and catch a game on their TV.  

And it's location is convenient as well...  close to The new Mission movie theater, and Bart. 

Give it a try.
author: Christiani C.

description: Love this place for late night music, tacos and drinks at the bar. The margaritas are the best!
author: Pati C.

description:
One of the last few places in the mission where you can enjoy drinks and food with your kin folk without worrying about yuppies/techies invading your safe space. Affordable drinks- an assortment of $7 margaritas that do the job. I personally come for the mango margaritas, but they have like 10 other marg+cocktail+beer opions. 

It's chill and there's usually a bunch of paisas with their family. I like the vibes- no pretentiousness from the space, staff or patrons.
author: Peeta B.

description: Food not that great! Bartenders need alot more training . I know they get busy but really? Can't say " I'll be with you in a sec "  maybe they were tired I don't know , service wasn't great.. I wish they would have cared on service I would have spent more and drank more and probably would be writing ! Omg I had a blast last night the bartender was awesome she knows how to make drinks ! -not the case - maybe next time .
author: cindy a.

description: Wow!! What a hidden gem. After La rondolla closed in the mission I didn't know what to do. I found Kava 22 one night. They have some real good Mexican food. No BS just walk up order and they deliver food to you quick. My favorite is their breakfast burrito and super burrito (HUGE). If you're looking for a bomb burrito thats not over priced or a taco Tuesday deal on tacos any day head on over. If you're yuppy and want $40 tacos then go to tacolisous.
author: Michael G.

description: Sweet spot to grab a drink and get some karaoke (great Spanish selection!). FYI Stop karaoke runs Thursdays and Sat night until 11.
author: Squeaky W.

description:
Was here on a Friday night to kill time so this review is just for ambiance and drinks. Location is prime and the restaurant it self was pretty large. Right when we walk in we were greeted by a mariachi band blasting throughout the place. The music was nice but boy was it loud and it didn't stop. This is the type of place that when you talk, you yell. lol. 

We seated ourselves and a waitress came over and handed us menus. We ordered our drinks, along with some waters. Chips arrived and a few minutes later our drinks sans water came out. I ordered the watermelon margarita. It was very good, great watermelon taste. They had a huge array of different margaritas. Chips were tasty, salsa was spicy! It took us asking three times to get our water which kinda sucked. We eventually ordered nachos and they were okay. All in all, just okay.
author: Liana H.

description: Our waitress was really nice and helpful, drinks were good.  Was nice that there was room for out large party.
author: Michael E.

description: The service was fine. The scene was alright. The quesadilla wasn't so great- it was made with American cheese which was not great quality. Only ate it because i was hungry. Monterey Jack would be better.
author: Nani B.

description:
I wanted to review Cavas 22 because I think this is a good place to spend some night and have fun. Mostly on Thursday this day you can go and enjoy the karaoke or be part of it. 

They have good food and the service is ok. The environment is good too. Some days are crawded than others ones.

If you want to meet people go on Fridays or  weekends, the rest of days are quite.

Have fun.
author: Eduardo S.

description: I think the place is okay... I order a mango margritta with  Chile  salt around the rim.  The drink over flowed and washed of salt.  Instead of salting another glass host brought  over more salt
author: Jade W.

description: One of the last "authentic" bars in the Mission. I hope they stay and never sell out.
author: Inigo M.

description: Careful: Adjusted my bill and added $2 to the tip amount. I don't intend on reclaiming the amount via my bank however it's worth sharing with other potential patrons. Overall, I enjoyed the margaritas and the divey atmosphere but not a fan of their questionable business practices.
author: A H.

description:
Margaritas for happy hour
No puedo mas que tomar y tomar
Tequila y Limon oh so sour
My body is swaying like the waves del Mar
Cava 22 I'll always go to you
With Mariachi and karaoke nights
The agave is always good and blue
In the mission where it's bright as the city lights
I'm here with my little having some drinks
The jukebox is playing our favorite tunes
We are not as drunk as everyone thinks
Although I do see a few stars and moons
One more Margarita please
With the tequila you're not a tease

by: Miguel and Jimmy
author: Maico C.

description: I came to eat here last weekend because we had been all around SF and this place was the closest restaurant to our parking space lol. We were super tired to walk to another Mexican restaurant 2 blocks away so we settled for here. The cashier was friendly and the menu had reasonable prices. The inside of the restaurant was decent. The food was good, nothing spectacular but it definitely hit the spot.
author: Lulu G.

description: Margarita specials for $3 until 6. Yum. $3 all draft beers even Ballast Point Sculpin. Tuesday's are .50 cent wings! Try the Lemon pepper they are to die for. Kid friendly and has Wi-Fi.
author: Vivi F.

description: Found this place when looking for a spot to watch the Warriors in the finals game 6. Crowd was fun and into the game. Happy hour, buckets of beer for $32 (serves 6) and pitchers of margarita for $28 (serves 5). Had a lot of fun, also recommend the tempura tacos.
author: Miguel M.

description:
This is one of my favorite Mexican restaurants/bars in the city. 

Why?

    Simply: 

    Great chips and salsa (the thick, deep-fried sort of chip).
    Large space (you can accommodate huge groups).
    Tequila bar (I love you, Tequila). 
    Sports games are on (without the "Bros").
    Enchilada plate comes with *actual* greens in the side salad. 
    Proximity (if you love LAC as your end up, this is a stone's through away). 

Why not?

    Mariachi bands in the evening (this place echos...).
    Food can't compete with the rest of the Mission's (sometimes the chips are stale :/)
author: Ashley K.

description:
Great place for taco tuesdays! You really can't beat $1 tacos all night long. The margaritas are also spectacular - strong and tasty just like I like them. The wait staff is friendly and the tacos are delish! I definitely like the carnitas the best. The chicken is a close second and the carne asada is a bit bland for my liking. But for $1 I honestly would eat anything. 

I will definitely be making another taco tuesday stop here soon :)
author: Junel S.

description: Cava 22 is just OK I would give it a 2.5 stars we went and the food was dry, bar tenders are old and drinks are not that great. They had no Coors Light when I went there and ordered buffalo wings but they had no buffalo sauce LOL. Anyways Mariachis show up and the party gets started...not my cup of tea.
author: Roberto M.

description:
Live mariachi band wearing white pants. Very fitting white pants. Very distracting. 
:P

That said, this place was fun! Very exciting and everyone there was enjoying themselves. Definitely not one of those Emo bars where singles go to sulk and whine about losing the love of their lives. The drinks were very inexpensive (although, it could be slightly inconsistent) but hey, who's gonna notice after a few? One of these days, I will come back to try their food!
author: Athena L.

description:
Mom's birthday. She's craving latino/mexican food. Where do we go? After much deliberation, we decided on Cava 22. Our other favorite Mexican restaurant is all the way in Half Moon Bay, and we weren't in the mood to drive really far.

Parking was surprisingly easy, considering it was a beautiful saturday afternoon around 6pm-7pmish or is that considered evening? Anyways, there was plenty of space on Bartlett! 

The place was almost empty, a lot of people sitting at the bar, with a couple people scattered around the tables. Our waitress immediately attended us, gave us our menus and chips w/ yummy salsa. Waitresses here tend to distracted easily, so again it was hard to get the waitress attention when we needed water/refills.

After a couple minutes of my brothers and my parents taking pictures and laughing, she came back and took our order. Again, I got the camarones al mojo de ajo. My parents and brothers got plates similar to what they ate last time. 

The shrimp was delicious! It tasted very fresh, the flavor/seasoning was amazing. The fries again, crispy enough, not soggy. And the salad was also perfect as well. 

Right as I was about to eat, "Poker Face" and "Bad Romance" came on the jukebox. And I couldn't help but dance in my seat. 

Good food, good music, and a good time with my close ones? I think I really like this place.
author: Sophia G.

description:
This rating is only for drinks.

This is a no frills hole in the wall establishment with decent drink deals and a great tequila menu.  Late at night there is a big mariachi band that will serenade you.  Bartender was friendly and crowd seemed pretty laid back.  It seemed like a locals spot so food must be good.  I  would say this is a good place to come to get a few drinks for cheap or a late night grub session, but probably would not recommend for a sit down dinner.
author: Tanichka B.

description: I love it it's near from my house  this time I must try  the food  last time I just had chips and salsa  drinks  but nice place I love it.
author: Victoria A.

description:
Worst. Caipirinha. Ever.  If there's one drink that makes me want to puke, run home, throw on sweats and stay in every Friday and Saturday night, it's probably this one from Cava 22.

Don't get me wrong; I love caipirinhas in general (Bossa Nova, Maya, etc.).  But this strawberry caipirinha was.. no thank you.

Nice people, cute ambiance, but my friend and I could barely sip and stomach the drink.  Well, she could.  Her cava was okay, but my drink was too muddled, too bitter, too strong.  The strawberries made it impossible to sip through the straw, and there was no sweetness to the drink at all.  It's like the alcohol completely took over, even though I tried to mix it a bit.

I may go back to try something else and maybe some of their food, but for now, Cava 22 isn't on my good list.
author: Tori S.

description: Came in around 5pm on a Thursday night for drinks and dinner with some friends and family. I was a little disappointed because it was really empty when we first walked in but it picked up later on once the live mariachi started playing have mixed emotions about the food and drinks because some days the food is awesome and other days it a little bland , same thing with the margaritas some days they are good other days they are just plain NASTY and watered down. I'm giving Cava 3 stars because it is a pretty chill spot it just needs a little more life, music and people during happy hour 4-11pm..
author: Claudia R.

description:
After having such a horrible experience here with security, I decided to give it another try during a slow day. It went great, although I still do not think this place is great for full meals, I do love their new selection of bar food. It's delicious and fair priced. I have forgiven them for the way they treated me and I am happy to say I have not seen nor heard of such events happening again (nor have I seen that poor excuse of a security guard). 

Happy Hour is my favorite time to go. Jose is a great bartender and super friendly. The margaritas are great!
author: Marianna E.

description: This place is awesome!! Came here on a Friday night had some strong drinks and they played mariachi music. I'm guessing the food is pretty good but didn't try anything. I like any place with overly loud mariachi!
author: christopher h.

description: What can I say about Cava 22? Only thing that really stands out in my mind is the festive and positive atmosphere! Great staff, great decor, great drinks, and great vibes from their clientele. It was definitely busy the night I went but unlike many other bars, everyone was polite about trying to get through the thickness of the crowd and one of the owners (young guy) actually took very good care of my group while we were there. He probably noticed we were new faces and wanted to make us feel welcomed. If you're in the mission, or in the city for that matter, slide through to Cava 22! Wont regret it!
author: Mitsu H.

description:
Great place with a group of friends, probably not that great with one or two. 

The margaritas are great here and they have them for like $4 at happy hour which is a great deal (and they don't water them down at all....so good luck). 

And yes, the Thursday, Friday, Saturday Mariachi band totally makes it. They are great (and if you are sitting in the front, or standing by the long middle table/bar toward the back, there is a very good chance you'll be surrounded at some point. 

Now, I felt a little out of my element my first time here, everyone seems to know all the lyrics to these mariachi songs! 

Then I did some research at http://www.elmariachi.com/ 

go to songs/lyrics and "songs every mariachi should know" after your first trip to Cava and you'll be well versed in no time.
author: Mike V.

description: For a restaurant the food is okay. For a bar the food is amazing. The tequila selection is good, but not that big. Nothing rare or interesting, but they do cover the top 20 or so. Can't say much about events or music, only been here once.
author: Will D.

description:
This review is based on the bar and the restaurant. 
The bar alone would have put this at 4 stars. The strength of the drinks is 5 stars, but the service definitely takes it down a peg. You have to make your presence known, regardless if you are sitting down or at the bar. The drinks are pretty strong and for an average of 7 bucks per drink, that's pretty great. 

I had the fish tacos for dinner and they were DELICIOUS.  I was absolutely surprised by how fresh the fish tacos tasted. I loved that the fish was not batter- fried (which in my opinion is a ploy to make old fish edible in some cases) and they put the slaw on the  side, as oppose to loading my tacos with a bunch of stuff I didn't want. The tacos were nicely filled w/ a lot of fish and a little chipotle/spiced mayo on top. The fish was moist, tender, and melted in my mouth. I got two sides with my dish. I chose vegetables and black beans. The black beans were above average, but a little heavy on the salt. The vegetables were pretty good but they were only distinct because of the use of garlic. 

Overall, Cava 22 gets 3 stars because of the service for both drink and food. If they had more servers, or could better explain which areas were closed versus open, I would definitely give them more stars. For the pricing, this place is decent!
author: Jocelyn M.

description:
I came here once for the amazing happy hour margarita special (my one true love) but am afraid to come back because I may or may not have skipped out on the bill. But let me explain:

The service is so frazzled (maybe only during busy happy hours?). I was at a table with a group of friends; we had a waitress, but she wouldn't stop at our table for more than five milliseconds before running off to tend to something else. We wound up ordering drinks from the bar. Upon trying to pay at the bar, though, the bartender shooed us away, saying it would be put on our table's tab.

Cut to the end of happy hour. We're all tipsy, full of chips, ready to pay up and move on to the next adventure. We were waiting a FULL 45 MINUTES for our bill that never arrived. We asked our waitress repeatedly. We talked to the bartender. We pleaded to other servers. We were literally waving our money around in the air, wandering around the restaurant, and no one would take it. 

So, we put what we thought our bill amounted to (sans tip) and left. There was some debate about whether or not this was a good idea because there were a couple weirdos next to us, well-aware of the situation and eyeing our notes. And given that no one had paid attention to us the entire night, it was safe to assume those weirdos might pocket our cash before our waitress would think to grab it. I'm not into the idea of paying for someone's meth, but I'm also not keen on the whole dine and dash thing, so we hid our money under a basket of chips and bounced.

I still feel awkward about the whole experience and have thus voluntarily 86'd myself, but I might work up the courage to come back soon - those margaritas are seriously killer.
author: Rebecca P.

description:
This is a review of Cava 22 as a bar, not as a restaurant.  Based on the reviews I am reading here, I don't think I would ever come for food.  We stopped in, first time, prior to dinner down the street.  As a tequila lover, I am always looking for another place to wet my whistle.

Their tequila selection is decent.  It's not Tommy's or Tres in its quantity of choices, but it covers all the bases with a decent selection.  I have no idea why they use Cuervo as the well tequila for drinks, I didn't know any bar was still doing that.

We asked for an upgrade on the tequila and picked Espolon, which added $2 to the $6 (not Happy Hour, more below), and was still a good price.  Although it's not made like the "San Francisco margarita" pioneered by Julio at Tommy's, it isn't super-sweet.  I would prefer fresh lime juice squeezed in and agave syrup to sweeten, but like I said, it's still good.

I really liked the atmosphere.  It reminded me of Mexico - just a hodge-podge of tables, the bar, TVs.  The crowd didn't just come from their button-down job around the corner.  It's not the least bit trendy.

There's a lot of posts about happy hour, and it's supposed to be 4-7 and $4 margaritas, but there was no happy hour pricing.  It would be nice to know, and also to see if the tequila upgrade could apply to the happy hour price.  We usually go downtown for happy hour margaritas at Tropisueno, which has a really good happy hour food menu also at happy hour.
author: Spike S.

description:
I am one very lucky girl!

My BF took me out to a nice sushi dinner then friends took me out to dinner at Cava 22 to celebrate a milestone in my work life!!!

Currently, Cava 22 is decorated with a giant skull holding a Corona in the middle of the dining room for Halloween. It is burgundy dark with fairy lights all over--very festive! http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cG-txGXNcZzxYSYkV99b2A?select=SSa2_ADrw7n4eRypGff23A   http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cG-txGXNcZzxYSYkV99b2A?select=UKH4sqPyTPI5ojJc2ea7cg

Cava 22 is a fun, loud and happening casual Mexican joint.  The place is great for Happy Hour and  for spending time with your dearest friends over some nice and strong glasses of margaritas, freshly made chips and hot salsa.

Between the 5 of us, we had:
DRINKS:
1 Blended Strawberry Margarita
4 Watermelon Margarita
4 Mixed Margarita/Mojito mixed 
1 Mojito
1 Caipirinha

LOW DOWN ON DRINKS:
*Watermelon Margarita as well as the Mixed Mojito/Margarita was nice, strong and refreshing.
*Blended Strawberry Margarita was too sweet and tasted like cough syrup but my friend liked it. (Tasted yucky to me!)
*Mojito--my friend said she had better.

FOOD:
Calamari with Zucchini Sticks
Zucchini Sticks
Camaron Empanazados (Deep Fried Prawns w/ 2 sides:fries/veggie)
Plenty of Complimentary Chips and Salsa

LOW DOWN ON FOOD:
* Food was good as fried food goes. 
*Hot, deep-fried and not greasy. The prawns were big and plump. 
*The Calamari was mixed in with fried zucchini sticks. 
*The Zucchini Sticks were not on the menu but they were so good! We requested an order that they gladly obliged.

The fun company made the dinner. Bring some fun friends and go somewhere else for a romantic dinner or intimate deep conversations. Cava 22 is a great place to celebrate where you can loudly make noises and get rowdy without being kicked out of the place.  

RECOMMEND: Happy Hour and/or Casual Dinner. $3 Happy Hour Margaritas from 4pm-7pm.

SKIP: If what you want is a more delicous authentic Mexican food, Yelp other restaurants in the Mission.

THANK YOU VERY MUCH!:  Heather, Russell, Alexis and Jannette, for a such a wonderful and lovely evening. Flowers, chocolate popcorn and cute necklace as well. I feel so special.  How could a girl get so lucky?!!
author: Leah E.

description:
Cava 22 is the typical restaurant that make you feel like you are in Mexico. They have really good tacos and Mexican food, but the really yummy stuff at this place are their margaritas. Watermelon and pineapple margaritas are my favorites. 

Location is good cause there are so many options to go pre and after this place. If you like Mexican culture, food, rancheras and people, this is your place.

Prices are reasonable, service is friendly, and the atmosphere  is just perfect.

I will be back soon.
author: Alex R.

description:
Loved-ed it!  So daddy asks where do you want to do for your bday celebration and momma says I want Mariachi's!  After a quick search on yelp I stumbled upon this place and so glad I did.  This place is more of a bar like atmosphere with some seriously good food with very reasonable prices.  The standouts were the chips and salsa (nice spicy kick), the ceviche tostadas, the WINGS!!, the ribs, the calamari, the snapper and the skirt steak... dang didn't realize all the stuff I tried.  The margaritas were very good too.  I enjoyed the jukebox selection of music, from hip hop to rancheras my perfect combination.  And yes I did get my fix of Mariachi's and I got to sing along to my favorite song.  This is a great place to hang out with family and friends, the service was super accommodating.  I can't wait to go back.

P.S.  be sure to try the cajeta empanadas, so yum!
author: La C.

description: Came here during the week for dinner and the place was empty, literally only the three of us , and even though there was nobody else there, the service was so slow.... Margaritas are okay, I have had better ones somewhere else, just around the corner.. Ehemm.. The food is alright, nothing special that I would have to come back or crave for.  The taquerias all around the area serve WAY BETTER AUTHENTIC MEXICAN FOOD than here.  I am giving this place 2 stars for the fun decor.
author: Claudine V.

description: So it's been a couple of years since my initial review back in 2011... And guess what people? I love this place still! Lol... Their food is delicious and their menu tends to change throughout the seasons, although, some of their originals plates are still there and always on point! The shrimp ceviche tostada is BOMB!! Their chicken bonita plate, the cheese, spinach and mushroom stuffed quesadilla and tacos are some of my favorite. They also have $2 taco, Tuesdays and wings Wednesdays. Cava 22 is a definite trust try when in SF or for all the locals as well. I have had lots of great memories here and have made some good friends as well.
author: Cesar N.

description: LOVE this place! Can't get enough. The food is delicious, the drinks are even better. Has a great atmosphere. Sort of have a tradition of watching Giants World Series here, and what better place to be at? The staff is all super friendly and attentive. I love that their drinks are reasonably priced and they are consistent with flavors. Great place to come and unwind after a long work week.
author: Karen U.

description:
I came here with a friend because I had a restaurant. com gift certificate. The only caveat: we had to order $50 of food - which is A LOT at this place for two people, but I was up for the challenge!

Right when we sat down our server gave us a basket of chips and salsa (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cG-txGXNcZzxYSYkV99b2A?select=8uTQH72yqFaEPSOIa8PMEQ). The salsa was great and had some kick to it, but I wasn't a big fan of the too-thick chips. I only ate two (so as to leave room for the impending feast!) and they were both loaded with salsa.

To reach our target of $50, we ordered mostly small plates and one entrée to share. There were some hits, but definitely a few big misses too:

TOSTADA DE CEVICHE (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cG-txGXNcZzxYSYkV99b2A?select=gjG5RCzwlq4yD_XQoM25Qg) - Yummy! I loved how refreshing this was with the lime. The creaminess of the avocado went well with the acidity.

TOSTADA DE CAMARON (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cG-txGXNcZzxYSYkV99b2A?select=iys-m1yryeV7ADCZDf2Y9w) - Not as good as the ceviche. It had a different flavour profile (even though they're both "lime marinated") - I thought it tasted like Thousand Island dressing...

SEAFOOD STEW (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cG-txGXNcZzxYSYkV99b2A?select=WOq_xmM5wnjn8f8XHR3aJQ) - My favourite dish! There was so much seafood - white fish, prawns, clams, mussels - and the broth was delicious. Only complaint was the way-overcooked mussels.

ROASTED GARLIC (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cG-txGXNcZzxYSYkV99b2A?select=VdT5pgQZ_PqLd7VA7rN9TQ) - I expected a dish called "Roasted Garlic" to be predominantly garlic. Nope - there were only about 8 cloves and the majority of the plate was taken up by the bread, cambozola, and fig compote. I smushed the garlic on the toast and ate it with the fig compote. Shortage of garlic aside, this was pretty good... except for the RANCID cheese. I normally love blue cheeses, but this was absolutely disgusting. I couldn't get the taste of the rotten cheese out of my mouth fast enough. 

PLANTANO FRITO (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cG-txGXNcZzxYSYkV99b2A?select=_IAOLXxsm8SfhElUGhN6JQ) - Delicious! Loved the cinnamon sugar with the plantains and that they weren't too greasy. A few of them were a little hard though :(

BBQ RIBS (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cG-txGXNcZzxYSYkV99b2A?select=u44hKTLT_MrvOye6O-y-ow) - Usually, fatty meat = tender meat, but they managed to eff this up. These were some of the fattiest and toughest ribs I've ever had. My friend only ate one and I ate the other three. If it wasn't for my inability to waste food, I would've stopped after the first one too.

SKIRT STEAK (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cG-txGXNcZzxYSYkV99b2A?select=C-3u3gVEArWaHsfJgaiBAg) - Biggest disappointment of the night. One of my restaurant pet peeves is when the menu description doesn't match the actual dish. Where was the arugula (replaced by a heaping pile of spinach) and radish? Argh! Also missing? Salt and pepper on the potatoes (one of the cardinal culinary sins according to Top Chef!) I had to add my own salt from the shaker they were so bland. Double Argh!! The worst part was the actual steak. It was tough, dry, and more well-done than the medium I ordered. Triple Argh!!!

I was impressed with the service though. Our server came to check on us several times during our meal (often enough so we didn't feel ignored but not too often that we felt pestered) and made sure our water glasses were always full.
author: Steph L.

description: I don't come here to eat....chips and salsa are enough. Drinks are good...can't complain. It's definitely a "starter" for a night full of shenanigans! :D
author: Carla F.

description:
I had not seen my gf Vivian for almost a yr and decided to meet her at Cava 22 for a drink, the place was pretty empty and I did not stay too long to really get the full experience so I can only rate it on those conditions. Overall it seemed like a decent spot and I would return. Maybe next time on a weekend...see if it's jumpin! 

Stay tuned for an update ;)
author: Bella B.

description:
This place has great margaritas! Happy hour $4 margs. There food is fresh and different than most Mexican restaurants you'll find! 

All the locals come here! Authentic!
author: Sarah P.

description:
Went to Cava 22 last night with some friends, plus some of their friends from out of town. Definitely a wonderful weekend place to go with out-of-towners because it possesses a very lively atmosphere with a live mariachi band and large tables occupied by friends and families.

My favorite part of Cava 22 (minus the live mariachi band) was definitely the food....delicious! We had overflowing baskets of chips and salsa, a few orders of delicious ceviche tostadas which were incredibly fresh and tasty. I ordered the chicken fajitas which were really good as well. This dish could easily be shared between two people, FYI. My bf had the fish tacos which were also really good and just really fresh. 

My only gripe about this place is that it's loud, I mean really loud, which just makes it a little hard to talk to people that you just met, much less talk to other people at your table besides the person sitting next to you. But I think if it were quieter, it would probably take away from the fun atmosphere. But it's a minor thing, but some people are really turned off by super noisy restaurants, so I just wanted to forewarn about that aspect.

All in all, I would definitely go back, probably with a smaller group, to enjoy the delicious eats and wonderful music.
author: Emily S.

description:
This place is just incredibly meh. After the first time I wouldn't choose to go back again, but one of my friends loves it and decided to have her birthday party there, bringing me back for a second time. The drinks are ok, it depends on what you order, the watermelon margarita is actually pretty tasty, but they are over priced for what you get. 

The food is mediocre and less Mexicany than you would find at a Celia's. The first time I came the service was kind of bad, and the second time we were there with a big bunch of people, so service was really good cause they had a party to cater to, but the poor waitress was very confused and got the orders wrong the whole night. 

It's not the worst place in the world, but I won't be going back if I can help it.
author: Hannah W.

description:
Sammy Hagar would love it.

Lots of tequila. Lots. Had one of the few tequila drinks since college. Reminded it is not my gig. Fortunately with age you learn that at one drink instead of five.

We did however go on a seafood bender. Grilled prawns with bacon (not enough of either and I didn't even eat the bacon). Seven seafood soup (the highlight). Tostada ceviche (not bad either).

Grilled chicken pibil style was fine. Could have made it myself with much less oil. The oil comment goes for each dish.

Prices were so so, service was slow and the loud atmosphere and music made conversation difficult. Any louder and my head would have hurt.

Almost would prefer a tequila headache.
author: Jason B.

description: This is one of my favorite spot in the mission. There food and drinks are really good. Everyone there treats me with respect maybe because i been going here for so long. Lol Nonetheless whether im on a diet or not i always enjoy eating there. Nachos when not on diet is the go too meal. My go to meal when on a diet would definitely be the house chicken salad. When i want to indulge in a dr8nk i ask for there margaritas.
author: Jonathan C.

description:
God, this place has just totally blown it for me.  I've gone three or four times, each time a little worse than the time before.  The first time I came here, I was hella excited!  Wide tequila selection, decent food, and live mariachi!  I totally thought this was a new gem in my arsenal!

Every time I've gone back, the service has gotten worse and worse, to the point now where it's actually a chore just to come here.  It's entirely possible to sit down and wait 30 minutes before a server even approaches you!  Who thinks it's a good idea to run a full mid-sized restaurant with one, maybe two, servers?!?!  And I can't really blame the servers, but when they finally do approach you, it's like I've insulted they honor for even entering this restaurant and making them work more!

The mariachi is still great and the tequila is still strong, but this place has killed my spirits so much that I won't be going back.  Good luck to you if you go - I hope you have better experiences than I.
author: Shannon C.

description: I went here again after not being in three years, just to give it another try. I was disappointed. The wait staff was probably slower than before and the noise was nearly unbearable but hey, it's a bar, too - what can I expect. But it was so loud it was difficult to talk. The food has not improved at all and seems to have gotten a little worse. My food was barely warm and non-descript. Meh. Would I got back? If I wanted to have a tequila party, maybe - and then only to drink with friends. I didn't find it inviting or even really welcoming - that was perhaps the noise. I really wish it could have been different but there it is.
author: Kris S.

description:
Nothing really special.

Overpriced, unexciting Mexican food.

The atmosphere is also very meh.
author: Norman P.

description: The margaritas are tasty and the bartenders are the sweetest. A traditional Mexican restaurant with great ambiance. The crowd always depends on the time but even with a large crowd it's great fun. This is my usual sports bar or just come for a quick drink/meal. They have taco Tuesdays, and karaoke nights Thursday. At times there is also mariachi that comes I. And although I'm not a fan of the music they are greatly talented. I never pass this place down.
author: Rosa F.

description: I love cava, the service could use some maintenance though.  Their slow and take a while to get to you. But other then that I have always had a great time especially when the mariachi is playing.  Food is decent drinks are great. we usually just have appetizers (oysters are delicious) definitely will continue to go for drinks and oysters.
author: Adrian A.

description:
Cava 22 is alright.

After a performance at Dance Mission, literally my whole dance group came to this place to wind down and get some grub.  This place is decked out with a full bar, tv's (for you sports kids) with spice of Authentic Mexican Food.

The margaritas were actually not bad and beer on tap, how can you say no?  One thing that definitely stood out was the live Mariachi!  We were definitely moving tables out of the way and started a dance floor where everyone stood up and start clapping and laughing and having a good ole time.  Definitely a night to remember.
author: Edrian D.

description: Great place - had a blast here last night with some friends. Good Dancing, fun staff, great cocktails - and a nice selection of Tequilas with knowledgable bartenders. It's a big place.
author: Rew C.

description: LOVE Cava 22. Don Amado, Jose or Omar at the bar are amazing! Im a Latino that lives in The Mission and this is my and my lady's spot all the time.  Not only do they have great Food but also a great pour on their drinks. And their people on the floor (Thalia, Cori or Angie) really take care of you. They have karaoke on Thursdays and Saturdays and On Friday's they have mariachi. Great spot!!!
author: Ed F.

description:
We had about 5 things from their seafood menu and they were all delicious. This place had a Cha Cha Cha kind of environment on Saturday night and everybody was having a blast during dinner time. There were like 3 birthday gathering going on. The mariachi sang happy birthday to each of them table by table.

The chile-lime grilled fish hit the spot with some lime and a little extra salt (my preference)...heaven. 

Awesome place. Loud, good margaritas, and solid food. Enjoy.
author: C G.

description: bleh, a very dive like bar, very crowded, stinky, and dark. we came, and we left.
author: Denise L.

description:
The Granadita drink with enchiladas was mire then enough for this diner. The music was pleasant enough and the atmosphere was dark enough for casual conversation without being too suggestive. The aloe plant art over the restrooms was nice yet the rooms were single stall.

What rounds this place out is the large portions and well priced fancy drinks that will burst your belt but not your wallet.

This review is just as cheesy as the burritos :)
author: Ricky V.

description:
I love this joint.

Cava 22 is 1 block from my apartment, and it's one of my favorite places in the neighborhood. Good food, good margaritas, reasonable prices, and one of the most eclectic mixes of people in the city.

I dream of their guacamole....
author: The Other Jeff A.

description:
The plan was to go to the Latin American Club, and apparently the place was too packed for our large party. So my friends headed over to Cava 22, and we met them there.

Pretty unassuming from the outside - is it a restaurant? Is it a bar? Hard to tell from the outside...and from the inside. It looked as though it was a restaurant that turned into a bar at night. I was definitely put off by the cover charge - fine, fine, it's only $5, but why should I pay $5 to stand at the bar? True, there was a DJ, but that was actually more of a negative than anything else. The DJ was too loud for us to reasonably carry on a conversation, but nobody was dancing.

As for drinks, everyone around me seemed to be drinking capirinhias, so I had a capirinhia. It was good, but nothing spectacular, especially given the $10+ price tag.

Given all of the great spots in the Mission, I would skip Cava 22.
author: Wendy L.

description:
You can't speak or hear over the mariachis AT ALL. I love Mariachis, but the acoustics of the place make it way too loud. It's supposed to be an authentic Latin American restuarant, yet one of the first items on the menu is Chicken Wings. Really? 

The one good thing is the margaritas. They help dull the headache you will get from the awful Mariachis.
author: Rebecca B.

description:
Scenario: Birthday girl, seven more ladies, dinner at Lolo, waiting for a table and you ...

What do you do? Go ...

No, you don't run away or call for backup ...

You go across the street to Cava22 and order some drinks for the ladies at the bar and make sure the birthday girl keeps a beautiful sm:)e on her face.

If you feel the urge, you can get up and dance to some salsa merengue being thrown down by the dj, but if you're not partaking in a meal across the street at Lolo, then you might consider having some fine Spanish Mayan cuisine here at Cava22 ... I didn't try the food, but the staff was quite peasant, the owner even checked on us constantly while we toasted the birthday girl at the bar.
author: Ryan V.

description:
This is rapidly becoming one of my favorite hangouts, especially since Amado (formerly a bartender at La Rondalla) started working here. The place has been redecorated as well. I'll try to update Yelp with new photos. 

Besides Amado being a great bartender, I've enjoyed the food here as well. I've had bar appetizers like oysters on the half shell (see photo above) as well as the seafood stew, and the cochinita pibil. The service was great.
author: Lucky G.

description:
Food-
This is not an "authentic" Mexican restaurant so don't expect the food to be something straight out of el DF.  However, there are plenty of great items.  Skirt steak is very good.  Lime-orange cilantro is a great touch.  Goes very well w/ potatoes and arugula.  Also try the ceviche tostadas.  Very good!  Almost as good as mom's.  Add tapatio and you're solid.   The rest of the menu is so-so (main reason for 4 stars)  


Drinks-
Margaritas!  $4 in happy hour.  Pretty good selection of different tequilas.  cheap tecates!  and they have the classics on tap.  


People-
Always meet great people at this spot.  mix of young crowd and older cats but it def works.  meet people from all over LatAm, Europe, and locals from SF.  a lot of interesting stories.  bartenders are very cool.  Amado is one of the best at his craft.  


Football/sports-
only 2 TV's but cool spots to watch giants games and world cup soccer (mexico games!).  Saw Mexico/Argy.  Result sucked but the atmosphere was amazing.  packed.  dancing/singing/chanting...it was awesome.  not known for sports though.  closed on Sunday's during NFL games.  good place to watch SNF or MNF is you want to avoid big crowds.  Saw Game 7 of NBA Finals last year here and the place was jumpin'.  


Atmosphere-
Mariachis Thu-Sat starting at 9:30pm.  2 songs for $20.  Outside of Mariachi it gets pretty loud on nights.  very good atmosphere.  cool people to meet. 

Service is a bit weak if you sit in the tables.  they take too long.  best option is sit at the bar and have Amado take care of you.  Best nights to go are Friday nights!  mariachi!
author: Ivan M.

description:
I decided to come to Cava22 because of all the reviews on yelp. For Valentine's Day my husband and I decided to try it out. We walked into the restaurant and it was almost empty. There were 3 people at the bar and 3 tables being served. 

We got our menu late. There was only 2 servers and 1 cook for the WHOLE restaurant. We got Calamari for an appetizer, a Surf and Turf for dinner and a Caesar Salad as well. When we got the calamari the batter was falling of the calamari and the other weird vegetables they put on our plate. We then waited for 45 minutes until our entrees came out by this point the restaurant was full. When my husband got his Surf and Turf it looked like something I could've whipped up at home and not paid for at a restaurant NO GOOD. When I got my Caesar Salad it was drenched in dressing.

We ate our food and we're eager to leave since it was gettin too loud and obnoxious in the restaurant. We then waited 45 more minutes for our check. During this time 3 tables walked out because our server couldn't keep up with all of his tables. Overall, I wouldn't come here again. Shitty service and Mediocre food. Not a good combo.
author: Stephanie N.

description: Sorry Ass Security Thinking They Somebody Wait Til Your Shift Over....They Really Let Things Go To There Head And Can Be RUDE....
author: Tee S.

description:
I'd been eyeing this place for some time as, from the outside, it looks so cozy and inviting.  The inside is surprisingly spacious, with a variety of seating options: long friends' tables, small intimate tables, countertops with high stools, and of course, the bar.  Unfortunately, all surfaces are hard, rendering the live music (which otherwise was quite good) a perfect cacophony of blaring voices and instruments.  I was here with 6 girlfriends and our aim was to catch up, talk speech therapy and other hot items, but the music was so bloody loud that we could only talk (yell) to our nearest neighbor, still conscious of the vocal damage we were doing.  (Hey, at least we're keeping ourselves in business!)  We ended up leaving earlier than we normally would have.

The food was sub-par, I'd say.  Shrimp Diablo was appropriately spicy, though that was the only "flavor" coming through.  Side veggies had a suspicious look and taste of having been frozen.  (It's SPRING people!  In California, no less.  Fresh veggies are so easy and abundant around here.  No frozen veggies please.)  Service was so-so.  We were there to catch up and chat, so normally wouldn't have minded the absent staff.  However, when we started to imagine blood dripping out of our ears from the noise, we began to get restless.

All in all, this is probably a better place for after work cocktails (and before the music starts).  They do have a decent Tequila selection and it is a pleasant atmosphere until the live music comes and blasts everyone away.  I'd be back for happy hour perhaps, but would head a block away to the delectable Velvet Cantina for dinner.
author: Ravena F.

description: REALLY LOUD MARIACHI MUSIC. definitely should have read the reviews before coming here. Big Portions of their salsa chips and gauc. Their buffalo wings are pretty good. Honestly though the loud music will make it so hard to hear your friends it's an experience all in itself.
author: Diana Y.

description: How does the food taste?  How is the service?  I will never know because I won't be eating there.  The management is not honorable.  I have a Restaurant.com certificate that is not supposed to expire and Cava 22 is supposed to honor it according to Restaurant.com.  Cava 22 did not honor it.  I wonder what else management does not honor?
author: Cocoeche S.

description:
It's Cico De Mayo everyday here, and somehow you wouldn't be surprise to see a woman with a goatee.  Cava 22 is a pretty nice bar, and huge hang out places for Hispanics. $ 3 Happy Hour is at 4 PM to 7 PM.

I happen to walk in with my lady at 7:30 PM and miss it. No worries, cause there was going to be live music. NO, not really it's seems like we came on the wrong day. It was Wednesday, and the Mariachi band doesn't perform that day. Only on Thursday, Friday, and Saturdays. The music they had, was pretty loud enough. So what else could me do. We were just going to drink a little, but we end up drinking way way too much. It's like going to a grocery store hungry. Talking about hungry. We had the muchies for some odd reason, and this place is known for it's Seafood. You see food, and you eat it. Cheesy, yes, but I saw Fried Calamari for $ 10. Expensive for one person, but for two.... Awesome!!! It's come with Zucchini sticks that didn't have much favor to it. The Calamari dish came with Cocktail sause. If you want to be cheap, you can just buy drinks, and they will served you chips with salsa. I will warn you, it's not like the healthy kind, it's rather pretty HOT!!!!!! That's why they give you water. The chips can be refill if empty if you ask.

Now to the drinks and Mr. HAPPY HOUR!!! Tequilas and Margaritas are $6 outside happy hour.  The beer are $3. I got a Bud Light, but they accidently served me a Miller Light. I got what I wanted by the end up of the night. Sodas are $1.50 and you can get one free refill with that. 

The service was so-so, our waiteress was not into serving as at all. She look like she was tired or something.

The bathroom were kinda bad, there was a lot of water. Only one person can go in at one time. I doubt I saw any locks.

Overall: I will come back even if there was one part of the evening I hate, but it's not due to the place.
author: Ivy V.

description:
Great happy hour
Cute waiters
$4 margarita's 
The salsa is too spicy but the guacamole is sooo fresh and delicious
The rest of the menu is kind of expensive but Im not impressed with their food. Dont order the oysters
The enchiladas were eatable. 
Really only go for their margaritas.
author: farah b.

description:
I found this place on restaurant.com and it was listed as a Spanish Tapas restaurant.

This is NOT a Spanish Tapas restaurant.  This is Mexican restaurant.  They do not have Sangria or Tapas.  Tapas are Spanish, this place just has small plates/appetizers and salads.

Tuesday, Thursday and Saturdays is when they have live performances.  I went on a Saturday and there was a Mariachi band.

The food was pretty good, however, don't expect an authentic Mexcian menu.  The menu is somewhat embarrassing American food; chicken fingers with french fries, Barbeque Ribs, Buffalo Wings with ranch dressing and celery etc...

We weren't sure if the menu had been abbreviated because it was after 10pm- but after reviewing the menu online, this seems to be the normal menu.  

However, some things you ABSOLUTELY should try are the empanadas and the ceviche tostadas.  The ceviche is quite possibly the best I have ever had in my life.  Also the Caesar salad is quite good.  The strawberry and lime caipirinhas (kai-per-een-yas) are delicious as well (once again caipirinhas are not Spanish nor are they Mexican- they are Brazilian)!

I feel like this place should be renamed and re-themed as a Latin fusion restaurant.  

Overall this place was nice, however, I just wish it hadn't caught me by surprise boasting that it was a Tapas place on restaurant.com or in it's name "Cava," which is a type of Spanish sparkling wine.

I would go again, but only for the caipirinhas and ceviche.  And possibly only during the week- the crowds on the weekends are extremely annoying.
author: Jillian K.

description: Food was ok.. but they made a mistake when I booked my reservation for 15 people... No mariachis until after 9 and our reservation was at 7 so it was pretty boring since they put us in a room all by ourselves! We asked if we could move to the main room since they screwed up on my reservation... They said no!!!Bad service!! It was a very unpleasant 30th birthday here!!! Will never come back!
author: Alejandra G.

description:
I'd heard incredible things about Cava 22, so when my company planned their party here, I was very excited.

I'm not sure if it was just because the food was pre-made and set up buffet style, but the amazing reviews I'd received on the food were a little...off. It wasn't *bad* but it wasn't *incredible* like everyone had prefaced.

The margaritas, on the other hand, were exceptional. It was a very fun and friendly venue for the company party. I'll have to go back and try the food again with a smaller crowd.
author: Lauren F.

description: Mariachi and tequila! I'm going back, Mariachi plays from 9pm - 10 pm on F-S-Su, their agave tequila is smooth and even for a non margarita drinker I found it delicious!
author: Adree A.

description:
Wow! They really make their salsa super spicy but I love it. I'm not a fan of sweet drinks, but I got to say that the watermelon margarita was pretty tasty. The ceviche was decent, though I'd recommend the fish over the shrimp.

I ordered the snapper with spicy tomato sauce (i think they added lime or cilantro in it). It was fantastico! I kept letting the sauce sit in my mouth.  Great drinks, nice bartenders, and good atmosphere to chill with pals.

Overall Rating 3.5 stars
author: Geo D.

description:
went here with some friends on cinco de mayo had a blast!!! Service was slow due to so over crowded... the ceviche tostada was yummy the calamari was ok and the chicken wings were spicy but good. 
The only thing is that there is only ONE bathroom stall :(  not good when it was packed with people...

Overall it is a great place for drinks with friends...PARKING is bad, so take public transportation...lol
author: Julia A.

description: Cleanist silverware I've ever seen!!  Also fish tacos are excellent. EVERYONE must go here when in the Mission.
author: Mandames L.

description: A'ight bar, but can be a bit hood sometimes. I don't think people come here for the food.
author: M R.

description:
I recently noticed the big banner out front of Cava 22 advertising their spectacular happy hour prices and did a little  DYL recon mission that turned into kind of a bender... and made a fan of me. This place has a top notch top-shelf tequila selection but also has cheap house margaritas made with the perfectly respectable Sauza Gold. There's also a good selection of other kinds of liquor and 5-6 beers on tap. I only noticed the Anchor Steam because it's my fav. 

I like the vibe of this place - it has a large, open floor plan, a neighborhood feel but isn't divey and has friendly staff and patrons. Also, it currently has awesome Spanish Halloween decorations going on and there's a large private room that the manager let me reserve for Halloween Eve without a deposit. Sweet.

Happy Hour Drink Specials - $4 margaritas (house tequila: Sauza Gold), $3 draft beers, and $2.50 bottles from 4-7pm. Margaritas are only $6 after happy hour, so I imagine the beers can't go up all that much either.
author: Kristina A.

description: This is my usual Friday ladies night out hang out, I love the margarita pitcher!! the chicken wings are really good and the service is great. People here know us and they are very friendly. I specially love the mariachi they have Friday nights
author: Glenda P.

description:
My family & I had dinner here for my brother's bday and unfortunately we all agreed never to come back there to eat.  Its a great place with a good atmosphere and friendly staff, however, the food was not great quality considering the prices.

First of all, the seafood is pretty old.  The calamari we ordered came with an old strong fishy smell.  It was so strong we had to return it.  The general rule is "when seafood has a strong fishy stench, its old".  Fresh seafood will never smell fishy.  

Next, my plate of jumbo shrimp had a long hair in it.  The worse part is, they didn't even offer to replace it.

It was obvious to my parents and I that the beans were not fresh.  They were from a can.  The rice was not authentic and bad quality.

The only things we did like are the cocktails, the flan, salsa and their salads.  Other than that, we wouldn't go back there for dinner.  It's a nice place, however, the quality of their food needs major improvement.
author: Daisy G.

description:
This place sucks so bad. There's all this advertising about tequila and margaritas outside and they hype it up like it's some big tequila bar. No. The bartender was a grumbly old crank who didn't give any kind of shit about the amazing spirit that the bar is supposedly all about. Our neon colored margaritas were awful: all sweet and overly sour leaving that horrible scratchy/dry feeling in your throat after a sip.

As far as I'm concerned it's an Insult to have Cuervo or any non 100%  Agave "tequila" as your well unless you're a regular bar. Give me a break. Put down the hideous sour mix and pick up some fresh limes for godsakes and get it together Cava 22. Fail.
author: Sara M.

description:
GREAT margaritas! Good food, and fabulous live Mariachi music on the weekends.

Good crowd, laid back atmosphere, good times!!! This is a Tequila bar, so I'd suggest ordering a Tequila based drink or a beer... who walks into a Tequila bar and orders a Caipirinha?? 

Great ceviche, and they have a great roasted garlic plate with a fig spread and blue cheese... YUM!!!
author: Bananas F.

description:
I started coming here regularly to watch the Giants games, just grabbing a beer and sitting at the bar. One day over the course of the game three people sat next to me ordering three different dishes, and at one point each of them would lean over and tell me, "The fish here is so fresh! You've got to try the fish!" Well, I figured, there's gotta be truth to it if three complete strangers felt the need to pass it on. The next time I came, I ordered the seafood stew (the $10 one on the small plates menu) and my head exploded completely and has never been the same again.

(For the record, I've since tried a bunch of other things here and never been disappointed. The black beans are delicious and the fried snapper in the chili lime sauce is outstanding. The lime in the ceviche tostada will take your head off. But at the end of the day, none of those things are SOUP!)

I have been trying to recreate this stew on my own with no success. I have tried to find similar tasting stew somewhere else in the city, since I no longer live around the corner from Cava 22 and want other options if the mood strikes me in, say, downtown. Well, no dice. (Funnily enough, the closest imitator I've found was in Livermore at an Italian cafe called Strings, for any fellow East-Bayers.) I have tried every cioppino on every menu from here to Santa Cruz and while I've discovered many delicious soups, none of them meet the deliciousness of this soup.

I have come back here for the soup three days in a single week. When I get sick, I make my boyfriend bring home this soup. When I am taking people from out of town out to eat, I take them here and make them try my soup. I have converted a few friends to the soup already. I ate the soup this Thursday. It is Saturday and I'm thinking about going back for some soup again. 

Did I mention it's only ten bucks? For fresh white fish, clams, mussels and whatever cocaine-ambrosia-love potion broth they serve it in? In a big heaping bowl with as much fresh bread as you want?

Now I've got to go order more soup. GET THE SOUP.
author: Diana S.

description:
Came here for a friend's birthday. For the margaritas. Basically, like all the other reviews on here, you come for the happy hour margaritas.

Aside from that, they're pretty good at frying food. I got a milanesa and it was ok. Didn't give me the runs, which is always a plus. Someone in our party got the deep fried fish, which was also decent. The calamari was again decent. See, pretty good at frying food.
author: Angela H.

description:
One of my favorite spots in the Mission. 
Their margaritas are the best!  
They have a huge selection of tequilas too. 

Mariachi bands are always here, especially on the weekends and of course, Cinco De Mayo. If you want to be seranaded, slip 'em a buck or two. If not, you can always listen to their jukebox. Huge latin music selection.

They offer chips and salsa with your drinks but, watch out for salsa bc it's really spicy, but it's so good!!
author: Heidi L.

description:
I can't say anything about the food since I came in here at 11p on a Saturday night. 

BUT...

Cava 22 has a live mariachi band that'll sing whatever you request?
AND $6 margaritas?
I have to add that their bathrooms are clean too.

I'm totally game.
author: Heidi C.

description:
Good food, good drinks, fair prices, good atmosphere.

Some reviews indicate maybe it's too crowded or noisy with mariachi bands later at night but I've only visited in the early evening.
author: Robert M.

description: From the outside it looks like a fancy wine bar. That was what i thought. Inside, it's a very festive Mexican restaurant. The mariachi situation was impressive -- HUGE BAND dressed in ornate uniforms. But, it was LOUD. My margarita was pretty good for $6, but the waitress was virtually nonexistent. For some reason, just being there, I got a big craving for fried ice cream, which they did NOT have. Sad.
author: Andrew K.

description: Cava 22 is definitely one of my favorite spots in the Mission.  Their house salsa is wicked good, and their house hot sauce is enough to set your face on fire.  Typically, I go there to watch the game on their screens and talk up the kind bartenders... Super casual and mellow, friendly, and a cool place to do some serious people watching.  Oh, drinks are stiff, too!
author: Tina J.

description:
Cava 22 was alright.  In a way, I feel like it deserves better than 3 starts, but if I'm honest, I can't say that it really rises to 4.  So call it 3.5.

We ordered margaritas with Herradura, which were pretty tasty (there's a pretty generous tequila selection) and had the Tostada de Ceviche for an appetizer.  It was small, but not as small as the $2.50 p/ order price tag would lead you to believe!  And also, quite tasty.

For dinner, I had the Empanadas (filled with sweet squash, peppers, & a spicy tomato sauce), which were good and filling, but far from the best I've ever had.  My bf had the fish tacos.  I am not an eater of fish tacos, but he thinks that they're pretty good here.  (As a side note, he actually mentioned to me that the fish tacos were the best thing about the place, and if you don't really like them, there's no real reason to eat at Cava 22 over any other Mexican place.)

Sure, I'd go back, but I can name any number of other Mexican places I'd go back to first.
author: Angela B.

description: Awesome place for tequila shots, live mariachi and getting loco with your best homies.
author: Alex V.

description: Great Happy Hour Specials, Margaritas for $4, bottled drinks for $3.  Many food specials as well.  Attentive staff, easy to get to location, and a large enough space for a moderate sized group.
author: Jennifer L.

description: Best margarita in town for sure.  Excellent camarones--grilled and served over fresh greens, very nice!   Can be very loud when the tables are full but that's kinda part of the fun--very mixed crowd, young/old/families/Latinos/blancos/pobres/ricos you get it all.  Great place to seriously eat drink and be merry!
author: Julia A.

description:
We were going to Cava 22 to attend a Tequila tasting event at 8:00. We decided to arrive early and have dinner or at least have happy hour snacks. We arrived around 6:30 and the place was fairly empty.

We ordered drinks at happy hour prices, margaritas and beer. Both were served promptly and were good. We then ordered appetizers Buffalo Wings and Tostada de Ceviche. The wings had no buffalo flavoring at all were like regular deep fried wings no spicey sauce at all. They came with Ranch dressing and we would have preferred Blue Cheese but they had none. The Ceviche was good but a bit way too much lime even thou this is what the fish is marinated it was a bit too stong with lime flavor but still it was good with fresh avacado slices on top. Their chips and salsa were good as was the service.
author: Tina L.

description: Came in here on an early Friday night and there was no wait which was great.Loved the fact that they serve free chips and salsa!Who doesn't???!!!Lol.Service was okay.It was a little slow.Food seemed decent.We just had the super nachos so I can't say anything for the rest of the menu. We ordered the blue agave tequila pitcher and you can tell they are pretty generous with the alcohol mixed in it.So, the drinks are strong. They had a live mariachi band so it was really loud.I felt like I was constantly shouting over just to keep a conversation with my girls.Prices seemed fair to me considering we had three full pitchers of the drink we ordered and with the nachos.The bill also included 20% tip for our party which was nice and it all came out to $100!Overall,I may come back here but definitely when there isn't a mariachi band playing!
author: Mellany D.

description: Bartenders are the best.. But waittess very very rude.. Food fantistic only thing I would not trust oysters ..overall nice place for late night security are a lot better than the ones before
author: Main G.

description:
Remember that time the Revolution Cafe was so packed and we were so thirsty that we walked across the street to Cava 22, only to be serenaded by a 10 piece Mariachi orchestra?

I'm not kidding. 10 people. 9 dudes and 1 woman. And they were kind of amazing. You felt like you were in a recording studio.

I didn't try any of the tequila-based drinks, but I ordered wine which was cheap and they filled the glass all the way to the top. 

But seriously- come here for the band. It's like nothing else I've witnessed. I think I'm partially deaf now, but it's all good.
author: Jared S.

description:
What's a good place to get your drink on after a night of burlesque rehearsing? Well, the Mission of course....

Always on the prowl for a new pit stop, the red lighting and dark interior lured me in off the street faster than melted cheese on a hot plate.

I had the fresh strawberry house margarita (on the rocks, no sugar thank you) and it was delicious. Quite refreshing and full of strawberry goodness (although bits of it were stuck in my teeth all night).

Our server was gracious, leading us to seats on a quieter section of the bar and with more space. She guided my man through a list of tequilas and I helped him with the licking and liming, heh.

The food smells pretty good in there too, but I had my eye on another venue. If I'm in the area, I'd go back. It's spacious, not inundated with folks and priced well. I could see folks crammed like sardines across th way at Revolution...just awaiting their doom.
author: Jessica P.

description:
all the out of town friends came to visit on the same night and we needed someplace we could all sit down and eat, so tried Cava since it is huge inside and has a bar. A star for accomplishing that.

We were the only people in there for a while, and the service was still slow. Except for drink service, which may be their strategy. 

The place was freezing. The fries were $9 and appeared to be frozen fries reheated. At least three regular entrees were not available that night, with no specials to pick up the slack. Bread was served after the dinner, even though it was requested when we first got there.

So the outcome was my honey is still pissed off about eating there, my friend from NY thinks I'm an idiot, and I am completely embarrassed for subjecting my pals to over-priced crappy food in a lame, all be it, spacious environment.

Got someone hanging around you don't like? Have them take you to dinner here.
author: Krismet C.

description:
Meeting your sweetie in the City after work when there's an elite event the next day?  Unwise.  Tequila in the mix?  Facepalm.  Working the next day and the day after, and getting dressed to go to the city in the back of your Scion box?  Palin-level-dumb.

But Cava 22 was worth it.  Angelica guided me through the tequilas and had a few good recommendations.  I had a Tres Generaciones blanco and slowly forgot about a few generations of my ancestors.  ;-)  Quieter spot to sit and have a drink on a weekend night in the Mission.  Great service, a fine place to unwind and conversate after a long day.
author: Joe B.

description:
We ate here last night and enjoyed our meal ... then ... A RAT WAS SCURRYING ALONG THE TOP PERIMETER OF THE RESTAURANT WALL ON A PIPE.

When we told our server, she said, "Yeah, I saw it to." WTF?????

I went home and puked.

I called the Department of Health / Environment today ... ewwww.

DON'T DO IT!!!!!!!!!
author: Erin H.

description:
Very good margaritas (home-made mix is KEY).
Fish tacos were delicious, and Very reasonably priced for the quantity of fish.
The menu isn't very Mexican - they've got steak, and an (amazing) appetizer that's bread and figs and gorgonzola and roasted garlic, among other things - and much of it is a bit expensive, but it's easy to find the good values, and they're very tasty.
Did I mention the good margaritas?  (and that was the House, mind you!)
The plate of chips & salsa they bring out is a bit silly though; I think ours had a whopping 12 chips on it.  For 3 people.
But the margaritas were damn good.

Happy hour margs are only $3!

It's a nice-looking, dark-paneled space; feels just on the edge of swanky.

Oh, and on a Sunday evening at 6 it was totally empty.
author: Don H.

description: I organized a happy hour here a few months ago and it turned out pretty crackin like a chiropractic! Its located in the mission and they have a very authentic feel to the place once u walk in it just screams 'MEXICOOO!" Anyways, their happy hour is pretty legit they serve these strawberry margaritas that are DELICIOUS but cost about $20.00 a pitcher. The food is good but not outstanding, it reminds me of a Chevy's with just more options. Still it tasted good and it wasn't too crowded at all on a Thursday so you dont have to worry about getting a waiters attention. Parking, like everywhere in SF sucks like a vacuum. On the weekends they have mariachi band playing LIVE and its really adds on to the feel of  MEXICOOOO if you know what I'm saying! Definitely a place to check out if your looking for something new and fun!
author: Julio S.

description:
My friend and I ended up going here because the wait for Esperpento was too long. Neither of us had been, but I had walked past it a bunch of times before.
